item.title: Wagner: Scale of Russian mercenary mission in Libya exposed
item.description: A Samsung tablet obtained by the BBC unveils chilling details of how mercenaries fought in Libyaâ€™s war.

item.title: Algeria forest fires: Dozens killed in Kabylie region
item.description: Algeria is one of several Mediterranean countries to face devastating wildfires.

item.title: Zambia election: Young voters may hold the cards
item.description: Zambia will vote on Thursday amid growing concern about high unemployment and inflation.

item.title: Ethiopia PM Abiy Ahmed calls on civilians to join Tigray war
item.description: Abiy Ahmed has asked all "capable" Ethiopians to join the fight against resurgent Tigrayan rebels.

item.title: Anger as Nigerian diplomat manhandled in Indonesia
item.description: Nigeria says there was "no justification" for an official's mistreatment by immigration officers.

item.title: Marburg virus: Man who died in Guinea found to have disease
item.description: A man who died is found to have had the highly infectious virus, the first human case in West Africa.

item.title: Nigerian Igbo Jewish leader arrested with Israeli visitors freed
item.description: Lizben Agha was held for weeks without charge after becoming caught up with the three men's arrest.

item.title: Tanzania President Samia: We're here to show that women can lead
item.description: When Samia Suluhu Hassan first became Tanzania's president some doubted her, she tells the BBC.

item.title: Malta: The teenagers pulled from the sea and accused of terrorism
item.description: How three teenagers rescued from the Mediterranean Sea ended up in Malta accused of terrorism.

item.title: Africa's golden moments from Tokyo 2020
item.description: BBC Sport Africa's Celestine Karoney digs out Africa's golden moments from Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Mozambique insurgency: Rwanda leads the fightback
item.description: A 1,000-strong force has made major gains against the insurgents since its deployment last month.

item.title: Abba Kyari: The Nigerian super sleuth wanted in the US
item.description: Highly decorated policeman Abba Kyari's reputation is under scrutiny over alleged fraud.

item.title: 'We want trillions to heal our wounds'
item.description: Descendants of victims of Germany's atrocities in Namibia say the money offered is not nearly enough.

item.title: The illegal gold mines killing rivers and livelihoods in Ghana
item.description: Sixty percent of Ghana's water bodies are now polluted, largely due to illegal mining operations.

item.title: Zambia elections: What you need to know
item.description: The economy is struggling and there's a tense political atmosphere ahead of Thursday's elections.

item.title: Tanzania: President Samia Suluhu Hassan on leadership, Covid-19 and democracy
item.description: Tanzania's president says there were people who doubted she was qualified.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The Olympic DJs playing in empty stadiums
item.description: DJs have found themselves in the unusual position of playing music in virtually empty Olympic stadiums.

item.title: Telfar Clemens: Designer creates Tokyo 2020 Olympic outfits for Team Liberia
item.description: American-Liberian designer Telfar Clemens created Liberian team's outfits at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Manga artist from Kenya on his passion for Japanese comics
item.description: Kenyan manga artist Shin explains his passion for Japanese comics and what it takes to make a great one.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Taking care of mental health in elite sports
item.description: Dr. Tshepang Tshube says it is vital for elite athletes like Simone Biles to protect their mental health.
